page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 21 Plan view showing how to determine average grade

When measuring daylight plane, height is measured from the average of the grade at the
midpoint of the building and the grade of the closest point on the abutting site.

For this side of this structure, the
average grade is the average
of the grades at these two
points

Fig 22 Detail showing allowable eave protrusion

wall plane

2'
max

The daylight plane must
clear the point where
the wall plane intersects
the top of the roof
material

Certification of daylight plane compliance:

Upon request by the building official any person
building or making improvements to a structure shall
provide a certification that the structure, as built, com-
plies with the daylight plane provisions in Code Section
18.12.040(a). Such certification shall be prepared
by a licensed engineer, architect, or surveyor, and
shall be provided prior to frame inspection. (Sections
18.12.040(j)).

27

visual_elements.description: A plan view diagram illustrating how to determine average grade for daylight plane measurement. It shows a 'Subject House' and a 'Neighbor' house, with 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', and 'Interior-side yard' areas delineated. Dashed lines indicate 'Required setbacks' and 'Buildable area'. Solid lines indicate 'Lot line'. Arrows point from the 'Subject House' to two points on the 'Neighbor' lot line, indicating the points used to calculate average grade for that side of the structure. The diagram also shows a 'Sidewalk' and 'Existing house' in the key.
visual_elements.location: Left half of the page, spanning top to bottom

visual_elements.description: A cross-sectional diagram illustrating allowable eave protrusion relative to a daylight plane. It shows a 'wall plane' and a sloped 'daylight plane' intersecting a roof structure. An arrow points from the daylight plane to the intersection point of the wall plane and the top of the roof material, with text indicating that the daylight plane must clear this point. A horizontal dimension line indicates '2' max' protrusion from the wall plane.
visual_elements.location: Top right quarter of the page

subheadings: Fig 21 Plan view showing how to determine average grade
Fig 22 Detail showing allowable eave protrusion

additional_notes: The word 'from' in 'When measuring daylight plane, height is measured trom the average...' appears to be a typo or OCR error, likely intended as 'from'.
Page number '27' is present at the bottom right.
